heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 16 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (162°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 71.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1254 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 156.2m lower than yesterday, 689.0m lower than the past week, 1254.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 689m to a maximum of 1098m, averaging 713.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1402.0m and 1967.5m respectively.
